meanings.definition: The act of postponing or suspending a session or meeting.
meanings.sent1: The prorogations of the meeting were necessary due to unexpected circumstances.
meanings.sent2: The parliament decided on prorogations to allow for further discussions next week.
meanings.sent3: The prorogations of the conference led to some attendees enjoying an extended lunch break.
meanings.sent4: Her prorogations of the study group were like pressing pause on a movie.
meanings.sent5: The prorogations of the trial made the legal process seem even longer.

meanings.definition: The extension of a legislative session beyond its original end date.
meanings.sent1: The prorogations of the congress were met with mixed reactions from the members.
meanings.sent2: The prorogations of the assembly allowed for crucial bills to be discussed thoroughly.
meanings.sent3: The prorogations of the council meeting made the politicians rethink their strategies.
meanings.sent4: His prorogations of the debate were like adding extra time to a sports match.
meanings.sent5: The prorogations of the summit gave the delegates more time to negotiate.

meanings.definition: The act of delaying or putting off something.
meanings.sent1: Her constant prorogations of making a decision frustrated her friends.
meanings.sent2: The prorogations of the project deadline caused stress among the team.
meanings.sent3: His prorogations of doing his homework resulted in a late night of studying.
meanings.sent4: The prorogations of facing the truth only made the situation worse.
meanings.sent5: The prorogations of addressing the issue delayed the resolution process.
